title: Are job placements good at Amity, Noida? - Quora

response.answer_text: I don’t know what standards you have placed for yourself to be considered as “good placement”. But let me answer you with atmost honesty. I’m not aware of other streams but if you are from engineering and really want to get placed, Amity Technical Placement Cell (ATPC) will absolutely help get one. I cant guarantee you, but chances are pretty high for placements ( unless you are super lazy to attend campus drives during odd hours and holidays or have performed supremely bad through out your graduation.)I cant and will not generalise the salary package but it will be similar to what other institutions offer as per “industry standards” ( 2 LPA ~ 4/4.5 LPA ).The above insight is for “that average engineering guy” who has just attended classes for 4 years and haven’t made many significant contribution to his resume. If you work hard on your skills, groom yourself up, score above average grades and make yourself an irresitable and wholesome person i.e above average, chances are high you can easily get 5 LPA and above. Many have done it, so can you.Hope that answers all your queries. TC, All the best. Vaisakh.

Over the years 27,000 Amity students have got on-campus placements in MNCs and top organisations. Leading companies across various disciplines come for campus placements at Amity. In technical courses, nearly all students are placed even one year before the completion of the course. This achievement has been the result of the a 60-member team of dedicated members of the Amity Corporate Resource Centre that constantly interacts with the corporate world and helps prepare students for their careers. Besides, the industry specific Career Advisory Boards consisting of leading members of the Corporate World give you guidance on creating a clear career plan, a list of appropriate employers, setting realistic career goals and a planned time table on professional development for your future. At Amity, a dedicated Corporate Resource Centre ensures the right placement for each student and everything we do is focussed towards this. Go to this link for more information—https://www.amity.edu/placement.aspx

Which stream and which Institution are you talking about? Coz Amity have got 150+ courses and not all course offers placement, but the one’s which do, they actually get good company on board and it all depends entirely on you, how well you are able to crack the interviews and bag a good job for yourself.

no placements for last two years out of 100 students from mba only 25–45 will get placement not by university but their own . bsc( it)will cost atleast 10–11lac for a students no placements .btech cse very less placement if got salary not more than 22000to 25000pm. also no placement for forensic science bsc +msc both cost atleaset 18lacs no placement.little better for btech mtech biotech. average package is 4lacs.

Amity Noida, being the main Campus has best placements among the Amity campuses, and also better than most of the private universities in India.But all depends on your branch and your interview along with your resume….
